info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 20 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN RUTHERFORD...POLK AND SOUTHWESTERN CLEVELAND COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles south of Rutherfordton to near Columbus. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Forest City, Rutherfordton, Columbus, Spindale, Boiling Springs NC, Polkville, Ellenboro, Lattimore, and Mooresboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
